definition: to sneak in/to infiltrate/to be piercingly painful/to be unbearable (of pain, itch etc)
to drill/to bore/to get into/to make one's way into/to enter (a hole)/to thread one's way through/to study intensively/to dig into/to curry favor for personal gain
boring insect/snout moth's larva (Aphomia gullaris or Plodia interpuncuella or Heliothus armigera etc), major agricultural pest

sentences.english: And just then, he felt a terrible pain in the back of his neck.
sentences.chinese: 而就在这时，他感到在他的脖子钻心的疼痛。

sentences.english: The corn borer is a cosmopolitau and seriously injured insect pests of corn in Sichuan.
sentences.chinese: 玉米钻心虫是四川玉米上的主要害虫，发生普遍。

sentences.english: The workers still kept on working in the river even though the water was icy cold.
sentences.chinese: 任凭江水冷得钻心，工人们仍然坚持下水操作。

sentences.english: The pain was excruciating at first, until the arm went numb.
sentences.chinese: 起初是钻心的疼痛，直到失去知觉为止。

sentences.english: There's a grub that kills them by boring into the flower.
sentences.chinese: 有一种钻心虫，钻进一条去，花就死了。

sentences.english: The pain would throb and pulsate, waking him out of a sound sleep and making him nauseated.
sentences.chinese: 这疼能疼得钻心，让他从熟睡中疼醒，呕吐。

definition: to ache/to be sore/to feel painful
to throb with pain/throbbing pain/twang/pang/CL:陣|阵[zhen4]
restless with anxiety/unbearably hot and anxious
to be drenched with blood/dripping blood
